refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: M = cummin(A) returns the cumulative minimum of the arguments of A. The dimension of M is same as the dimension of A. If A is a 2D matrix, the operation is performed along the columns. For a hypermatrix, the operation is performed along the first non-zero dimension M = cummin(A,dim) The operation is performed along the dimension specified by dim M = cummin(_,direction) direction specifies as the direction of operation

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
1) Cumulative minimum values in a vector v = [8 9 1 10 6 1 3 6 10 10] M = cummin(v)
Expected output: [8 8 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 1]
